replies.body:
A few things you did wrong this game, but nothing that warranted a permaban unless you have had a 14-day ban in which case you were on thin ice anyways and any punishable behavior no matter now minor could have resulted in a permaban.

Some advice, although too-little-too-late:

1. Don't call for other people to help report someone, for multiple reasons:
 - because multiple reports don't stack so ganging up on somebody won't actually increase their likelihood of being reviewed and punished.
 - because ganging up on somebody to make them feel persecuted is actually a form of bullying, and is absolutely punishable in Riot's eyes.

2. Don't call attention to the person. Because if they are trolling, this is exactly what they want. Don't feed the troll, you will only make them want to behave even worse. This applies both to calling for reports against them AND talking to them repeatedly in response to their trolling actions.
Somebody who is doing what this guy did should absolutely feel persecuted. People who troll should get id bans for a first offense. Honestly. It is that ridiculous.

Well, like I said in the rest of the comment that you ignored. You only made the situation worse. You fed their behavior, you made them want to troll you more. And YOU actively contributed to making the experience more negative for everybody else.

In response to your specific point about making someone feel persecuted: It's not your place/right/job to do so. Your role as a player is to play the game. It is Riot's role to review and punish players. You overstepped your bounds and got punished for it. Learn from it or don't, but remember that if you choose to continue to feed trolls then Riot will punish you accordingly.
You spent the entire game saying nothing in chat except flaming singed. seems pretty justified, considering you must have had previous chat restrictions and learned nothing from them.
